SenderStatisticsByTagNameAndBatchID.summary: Retrieve Sending Data under Specified Conditions

schema.description: Sending address. If not filled, it represents all addresses.
Start time, in the format yyyy-MM-dd.
End time, which cannot exceed 7 days from the start time, in the format yyyy-MM-dd.
Email tag. If not filled, it represents all tags.

SenderStatisticsByTagNameAndBatchID.title: Retrieve Sending Data under Specified Conditions

schema.description:
Sending address. If not filled, it represents all addresses.

> **AccountName**, **TagName**, and **ToAddress** can all be left unfilled. If any are filled, only one of these parameters can be passed; you cannot pass a combination of two or more.
Recipient address. If not filled, it represents all recipient addresses.

Delivery result. If not filled, it represents all statuses. Values:

- 0: Success
- 2: Invalid Address
- 3: Spam
- 4: Failure
Start time. The span between start and end times cannot exceed 30 days, format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
End time. The span between start and end times cannot exceed 30 days, format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm.
Email tag. If not filled, it represents all tags.
Specifies the number of results to return in this request. Range is 1~100.
Used for pagination. Specifies the offset for this request. If there are more results, set this returned value to the NextStart in the next request.

NextStart.description: Used for pagination. If there are more results, set this returned value to the NextStart in the next request.

Status.description: Delivery status: 0 Success, 2 Invalid Address, 3 Spam, 4 Other Failures

ErrorClassification.description:
Detailed classification of error reasons: - SendOk - SmtpNxBox
etc.

GetTrackListByMailFromAndTagName.title: Retrieve Email Tracking Data by Sender Address and Tag

schema.description: The sending address configured in the management console.

Address type. Values:

0: Random account

1: Sending address

A tag created in the email push console, used to categorize batches of sent emails. You can use tags to query the sending status of each batch. Additionally, if the email tracking feature is enabled, you must use an email tag when sending emails.
Whether to enable the reply-to address configured in the management console (the status must be verified). The value range is the string `true` or `false` (not a boolean value).
Recipient addresses. Multiple email addresses can be separated by commas, with a maximum of 100 addresses (supports mailing lists).
Email subject, with a maximum length of 100 characters.
Email HTML body, limited to 80K by the SDK. Note: HtmlBody and TextBody are for different types of email content, and one of them must be provided.
Email text body, limited to 80K by the SDK. Note: HtmlBody and TextBody are for different types of email content, and one of them must be provided.

Sender alias, with a maximum length of 15 characters.

For example, if the sender alias is set to "Xiaohong" and the sending address is test***@example.net, the recipient will see the sending address as "Xiaohong" <test***@example.net>.
Reply-to address
Reply-to address alias

1: Enable data tracking function

0 (default): Disable data tracking function.

Type of generated unsubscribe link. Refer to the [Unsubscribe Function Link Generation and Filtering Mechanism](~~2689048~~) document.

disabled: Do not generate

default: Use the default strategy: Generate unsubscribe links for bulk-type sending addresses to specific domains, such as those containing the keywords "gmail", "yahoo",

"google", "aol.com", "hotmail",

"outlook", "ymail.com", etc.

zh-cn: Generate, for future content preparation

en-us: Generate, for future content preparation

Filtering level. Refer to the [Unsubscribe Function Link Generation and Filtering Mechanism](~~2689048~~) document.

disabled: Do not filter

default: Use the default strategy, bulk addresses use the sending address level filtering

mailfrom: Sending address level filtering

mailfrom_domain: Sending domain level filtering

edm_id: Account level filtering

Currently, the standard fields that can be added to the email header are Message-ID, List-Unsubscribe, and List-Unsubscribe-Post. Standard fields will overwrite the existing values in the email header, while non-standard fields need to start with X-User- and will be appended to the email header.
Currently, up to 10 headers can be passed in JSON format, and both standard and non-standard fields must comply with the syntax requirements for headers.
dedicated IP pool ID. Users who have purchased an dedicated IP can use this parameter to specify the outgoing IP for this email.
Only supported for use with the new version of the SDK; not currently supported by openapi and signature mechanisms.

items.description: Only supported for use with the new version of the SDK; not currently supported by openapi and signature mechanisms.

AttachmentUrl.description: Only supported for use with the new version of the SDK; not currently supported by openapi and signature mechanisms.

AttachmentName.description: Only supported for use with the new version of the SDK; not currently supported by openapi and signature mechanisms.

400.errorMessage: The format of the receiver name is invalid. It must contain the @ sign. The domain must only contain numbers, letters, underscores, minus signs, and periods. The account name must only contain numbers, letters, underscores, minus signs, and periods.
The specified subject is invalid. It must not exceed 100 characters.

404.errorMessage: The specified mail address is not found.

schema.description: The name of the template that has been created and approved in advance.
The sending address configured in the management console.

The name of the recipient list that has been created and uploaded with recipients. Note: The recipient list should not be deleted until at least 10 minutes after the task is triggered, otherwise it may cause sending failure.

- 0: Random account
- 1: Sending address
Email tag name.
Reply address
Alias for the reply address

- 1: Enable data tracking function
- 0 (default): Disable data tracking function

The type of generated unsubscribe link. Refer to the [Unsubscribe Function Link Generation and Filtering Mechanism](~~2689048~~) document.
- disabled: Do not generate
- default: Use the default strategy: Generate an unsubscribe link when a bulk-type sending address sends to specific domains, such as those containing keywords like "gmail", "yahoo",
"google", "aol.com", "hotmail",
"outlook", "ymail.com", etc.
- zh-cn: Generate, for future content preparation
- en-us: Generate, for future content preparation

Filtering level. Refer to the [Unsubscribe Function Link Generation and Filtering Mechanism](~~2689048~~) document.
- disabled: No filtering
- default: Use the default strategy, bulk addresses use sender address-level filtering
- mailfrom: Sender address-level filtering
- mailfrom_domain: Sender domain-level filtering
- edm_id: Account-level filtering

Currently, the standard fields that can be added to the email header are Message-ID, List-Unsubscribe, and List-Unsubscribe-Post. Standard fields will overwrite the existing values in the email header, while non-standard fields must start with X-User- and will be appended to the email header. Currently, up to 10 headers can be passed in JSON format, and both standard and non-standard fields must comply with the syntax requirements for headers.
dedicated IP pool ID. Users who have purchased an dedicated IP can use this parameter to specify the outgoing IP for this send operation.
Template ID
Sender address, with a maximum length of 60 characters
UserName, with a maximum length of 30 characters
NickName, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Birthday, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Gender, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Mobile, with a maximum length of 30 characters
Recipient address, with a maximum length of 60 characters
Detailed information
Domain name, length 1-50, can include numbers, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, ., and -.

The selector field in the DKIM protocol, used to identify a specific public key. It is recommended to leave it blank, as the system will automatically generate it based on cluster information. If the user specifies it manually, for example, if the sending domain is "sub.example.com" and dkimSelector is set to "default", then the host record will be "default._domainkey.sub"
Constraints: 
1. The length must not exceed 60 characters. 
2. It must consist of visible characters only. 
3. It cannot start with a hyphen (-). 
4. It cannot end with a hyphen (-). 
5. It cannot contain any of the following characters: _ :;/!*~.@#$%^&()+=[{]}|?<>,'"
Domain ID.
Domain name, length 1-50, can include numbers, uppercase letters, lowercase letters, ., and -.

- Length should be between 10 to 20 characters, and must contain numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters.

- At least 2 digits, 2 uppercase letters, and 2 lowercase letters are required, and neither digits nor letters can consist of a single character repeated.

- Cannot be the same as the last set password.

schema.description: Domain ID. Can be obtained through QueryDomainByParam.
Determines whether to perform real-time DNS resolution

SpfRecord.description: SPF record value provided by the email push console

CnameConfirmStatus.description: Indicates whether the CNAME host record has been modified, 1 for modified (reverting to the original value also counts as modification), 0 for not modified.

DefaultDomain.description:
Whether it is the default domain,

Value: 0 No (this field is deprecated)

CnameRecord.description: Custom part of the CNAME host record

CnameAuthStatus.description: CNAME verification flag, 0 for success, 1 for failure.

IcpStatus.description: Filing status. **1** indicates filed, **0** indicates not filed.

DnsTxt.description: Ownership record value resolved from the public network domain

DnsSpf.description: SPF record value resolved from the public network domain

SpfAuthStatus.description: SPF verification flag, 0 for success, 1 for failure.

MxRecord.description: MX record value provided by the email push console

MxAuthStatus.description: MX verification flag, 0 for success, 1 for failure.

DnsMx.description: MX record value resolved from the public network domain

DomainStatus.description:
Domain status. Indicates whether the verification was successful, with values:

- **0**: Available, verified successfully
- **1**: Unavailable, verification failed

TracefRecord.description: CNAME record value provided by the email push console

DomainType.description: Ownership record provided by the email push console

SpfRecordV2.description: SPF record. Previously, the SPF display content needed to be calculated by the calling end based on the spfRecord in the response. The new field spfRecordV2 replaces spfRecord, and the calling end can directly display this field after obtaining it;

DkimRR.description: DKIM host record, the key that the user needs to set in the DNS for the DKIM record

DkimPublicKey.description: DKIM public key value, the value that users need to set for the DKIM record in DNS

DkimAuthStatus.description: DKIM verification flag, indicating whether the DKIM record set by the user in DNS has passed validation, 0: Passed, 1: Not passed

DnsDmarc.description: DMARC record value resolved through the public domain name

DmarcAuthStatus.description: DMARC verification flag, indicating whether the DMARC record set by the user in DNS has passed validation, 0: Passed, 1: Not passed

schema.description: Recipient list ID

Content, supports uploading multiple recipients at once, with a limit of 500 records per upload. Each record is separated by {} and commas, example:

[{ },{ },{ }...], the format within {} is as follows:

[{"b":"birthday","e":"xxx@example.net","g":"gender","m":"mobile","n":"nickname","u":"name"}], when passing values, pass it as a string, not a list.

If a duplicate recipient address is inserted, it will return "ErrorCount": 1
